pullRequest.body:
This file does 3 things in relation with Groebner bases.

* Definition of monomial order
* Division algorithm for a given monomial order
* The four main examples of monomial orders : lex, revlex, deglex and degrevlex

It is used in PR #16177 on the Combinatorial Nullstellensatz

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

```suggestion simp? ```
bot fix style

```suggestion
  /-- `syn` is a linearly ordered cancellative additive commutative monoid -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- `toSyn` is monotone -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- the additive equivalence from `σ →₀ ℕ` to `syn` -/
```

```suggestion
attribute [instance] MonomialOrder.locacm MonomialOrder.wf
```

```suggestion
get them as instances.
```

```suggestion
We provide four examples of monomial orders, the most standard ones in commutative algebra.
```

```suggestion
For this, `σ` needs to be endowed with an ordering relation which satisfies `WellFoundedLT σ`.
```
(There are other similar typos in the file.)

```suggestion
  locacm : LinearOrderedCancelAddCommMonoid syn := by infer_instance
```
Doing this, in the subsequent definitions, you do not need to specify the field `locacm` if an instance can be found (which is the case in the definitions below). The same applies to `wf`.

```suggestion
namespace MonomialOrder

variable {σ : Type*} (m : MonomialOrder σ)

```

```suggestion
```
Here, I would suggest defining only one equivalence `equivDegLex : α ≃ DegLex α`, and two functions `toDegLex : α → DegLex α` and `ofDegLex : DegLex α → α`.
I was basically copying what is already done for `Lex`, which defines the two equivalences.

I would suggest this:
```lean
theorem toDegLex_injective : Function.Injective (toDegLex (α := α)) := fun _ _ ↦ _root_.id
```

Then, in one direction, you may `apply toDegLex_injective`, and due do the `Function.Injective` API, the `iff` lemma is ` toDegLex_injective.eq_iff`:
```lean
theorem toDegLex_inj {a b : α} : toDegLex a = toDegLex b ↔ a = b := by
  rw [toDegLex_injective.eq_iff]
```
Then, these phrasings `toDegLex_inj` would become unnecessary.

I will add `toDegLex_injective`, but I have the impression that `toDegLex_inj` remains useful. At least, this duplication already happens in mathlib, see docs#Subtype.coe_inj and docs#Subtype.coe_injective.

The following names should be more coherent with the naming conventions:
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma DegLex.forall_iff {p : DegLex α → Prop} : (∀ a, p a) ↔ ∀ a, p (toDegLex a) := Iff.rfl
@[simp] lemma DegLex.exists_iff {p : DegLex α → Prop} : (∃ a, p a) ↔ ∃ a, p (toDegLex a) := Iff.rfl
```

These variables are not unused. In the definition of `DegLex`, the docstring refers to `M`, but the definition uses `ℕ`. `Finsupp.degree` is defined only for `ℕ`. Did you intend to get more general definitions?
Probably,  indeed, especially because I'm not satisfied with `Finsupp.degree`, which is uselessly restricted to `ℕ`, and about which I have conflicted views.
Meanwhile, I'll remove unused variables.

```suggestion
  wf : WellFoundedLT syn := by infer_instance
```

pullRequest.title: feat (Mathlib/RingTheory/MvPolynomial/Groebner) : monomial orders and division
